content.label: I do not hate this game for being what it is meant to be, a clicker game. But I believe that there are many other clicker titles that bring way more to the table and are completely free. There isn’t much depth exept buying more and better automation for clicking. In the end there isn’t really any reward or any goal to go towards, just to make that number bigger and only that. On top of this it does not format to my device (iPhone XS Max) and many others which makes the playable area minuscule.
Not very satisfying to play as a clicker game when you can be fully done with it in a few days... would be better with achievements or updates of some kind
This game is great but its too short.

It is a different game, easy and fun to play but the long thing as the end was annoying. I closed out the app twice hoping to skip and move to the next part only to find the end of the game. To short of a game with a way to long closing video.

title.label: The text is way to small

content.label: The text is too small to read on an iPhone XS. No joke, I’ve had to play it with a magnifying glass.

title.label: Would be awesome if there were a sequel

content.label: Plain and simple
I couldn’t put this game down!  No ads or micro transactions. Spaceplan is a clever, wonderful story and a tight, well-designed clicker game to tell it. Amazing work.
Pretty fun game but felt far too short for the money. The ending felt weak and unsatisfying. Really enjoyed playing what game there is, but definitely needs more content
Dat ending hit me in the vibes.

Typically incremental games feature text or  basic graphics and nearly fully player driven. SPACEPLAN adds a relaxing and beautifully simplistic environment to take you through the silly but enjoyable story line. The ending makes all the effort worth it, providing an end goal not typical to the genre.

Playing through this relatively short game in this genre took me 3 days playing a few hours a day. The price tag had me worried but in the end I felt it was justified in the end to consume the atmosphere that I can tell Jake enjoyed crafting. I wish it was a bit longer, I am sure some amazingly creative ideas can come out of the plot and mechanics of the universe we are playing in and would love to see the app updated to include more replayability.

I would recommend this game for those who enjoy a 410-like art style and want a fresh take on an incremental game.

I like the beginning the best. 
But when he added Surrealism, you can tell the creator got bored.
It’s was good but was to short

Finished within 48hrs of purchase, was hoping for something more in depth.  

Sound, dialog, and graphics are all great.

title.label: How does this have only 4.1 Stars?!

content.label: I love this game. I think they did a great job making it and it deserves better reviews. I’m still playing it and haven't beat it but so far everything is great and I honestly don’t want it to end! Shame on the people who only gave this game one star!

title.label: Short game with too long movie at the end

content.label:
The only idle clicker which finishes in few hours. Also there is pointless movie at the end which lasts for 10 minutes and you can do nothing while random animations are spawning.
Waste of money.
You guys must like potatoes.
Well the game is nice, plus TONS OF TATERS
Although it’s not what I came for I’m very glad I got it it’s an amazing game

When I first downloaded this game I was sure it would be good, but after playing for about 30 minutes I realized how amazing it is. The game is so much more than a clicker, it’s a full on story. It brings you through this amazing experience with an A.I. that talks to you and explains things. As you go through the solar system in your spaceship you see tons of cool mechanical designs. There is an actual challenge, and the game has goals that you work towards making it one of the best and most unique clickers I have ever played. You will love this game even more if you are into futureistic stuff. I would definitely recommend this game to anyone who wants a mind blowing game that’s not too long.

title.label: Funny game. But it’s too short.

content.label: You could finish this game in less than 5 hours. However the self awareness and comedy of this game is really enjoyable.

title.label: This game is great but needs more

content.label: On my first play through, I loved this game. I thought it was amazing. Everything fits so well together. But after that. It was over. It took me like 4 days to beat and that was checking it twice a day. Definitely a great game but wish there was more

I admit I wasn’t expecting too much from this game but the storyline is enjoyable, it has some interesting puzzle elements unlike what you usually see in idle games, and the AI companion is very funny. Well worth playing through twice for the ending.

title.label: Good game, IF I COULD PLAY IT!

content.label:
Now I love space plan, but every time I open the app it crashes or gives me a blank screen,
SO DONT WASTE YOUR MONEY!

This is honestly the best mobile game I’ve ever played, This space-styled clicker has a great storyline and amazing cutscenes, this game was such a great experience I would recommend it to anyone. The $1 I payed was definitely worth it. Such a great game!
Game doesn’t load anymore, but gets stuck on a black screen.

Pretty great, reminds me of the paper clip universe browser game. Got $3 worth of enjoyment out of it, and already started looping around again. It doesn’t fit the iPhone X screen shape yet, and the text is really small, hope they address those two points so it’d be a little more fun.

title.label: Amazing concept and story but two days to best an idle. F’ing rediculous

content.label: I loved this game. Amazing story and witty sarcastic comments. I was thinking this is the clicker/idle for a rick and morty fan. It was great tge first night i tapped away wasting time before i went to bed. Second day it got real interesting!  I was amazed by the simplicity but didnt want to put it down.  Then the third day it ends. What a waste of a great idea. I really thought i was going to 5 star this because i love idle games. If this had 1/10 the depth of realm grinder i woulda been hooked for a while. Complete dissatisfaction. Ugh. So disappointed

Hoping the eves read this, but seeing as how it has been two years since any kind of update I am not holding my breath. I was really enjoying this, which was nice since I don’t normally like ideal clickers. But this one was quirky and humorous and creative in its story. But I had only been playing for about a day. Got to the stage where I was trying to add mass to the sun to reverse time or something. Left it idle and did other things for a few hours and when I came back it was just a blank black screen. Restarting the game changed nothing, nor did restarting my iPad. What gives? Would have given 5 stars, but will don4 for now. If I can’t get an answer should I edit it down tom1 or 2? Not sure.
Update the game. Update the game.

I mean it’s a good game; it feels very polished, even though it doesn’t fit newer phones with notches and taller screens. It is only a few days long if you play it intensely, if you went hard you could probably complete it in 2 days. There is no replay value, so that’s pretty much all you get. I see a lot of other people comparing it to like a $20 movie ticket and saying you’re paying for the experience. When you compare it to that sure it’s worth it, but then again so is almost every other app. TL;DR if you have an income go for it, it’s a good game.
The story is good but short. After completing the game there isn’t any progression that keeps you wanting to play.

Ok I love this game but it ENDS! Unacceptable for an idle game. But this is a good game. It’s just idle games are not supposed to end! It doesn’t even take that long to beat! 2 DAYS I TELL YOU, 2 DAYS! It is a good game tho.

title.label: Nice idle game with a story

content.label: This was a pretty fun idle game and the story was great. Biggest flaw is that the game is pretty short, making the price tag a bit steep in my opinion
Not bad. Some funny moments. Mechanics spread out a very sparse game into a slow several days.

title.label: Best clicker I have ever played

content.label: Sound is incredible, visuals are ingenious, dialogue is funny. Definitely worth 3$

If you like clickers, do not buy. I bought the game yesterday, and finished it today. Clicker games are built on replayability, but as soon as this game gets interesting, the credits roll and it's end game. No rebirths, no scaling, no mass-buying, nothing that a standard idle clicker would normally have. 1/5
Great time waster, maybe a little too pricey for the amount of game you get. Great game and value at $1.99.

This game is pretty fun for someone like me who plays a lot of clicker games. But this one feels different, it’s like it has a story along with the game as you progress through the game. Along with its story, it has certain ways to make you progress faster so you won’t have to spend forever on the game. It’s sad that this game is kinda short, but it’s still awesome. But, (This part is specifically to the creators) I tried playing the game today but it’s frozen, I’m not sure if it’s a glitch or if it’s some kind of bug, but it’s still fun. I think everyone should play this game.

I bought this game for 3 dollars and it was worth every penny but you have to like clickers because it’s not fun when you don’t like it btw played this game for a month now     Also the music is the best for this energy space clicker and this is not a fake review

Personally I feel like it was a fantastic little game, but was it worth $3? Maybe if it was longer and had a bit more to it. If you’ve got the money to spare I’d highly recommend this game to you. In terms of clicker/idle games it’s one of the better ones I’ve ever played.

This game is actually an amazing game.  A very good game to say the least.  The reason I gave it three stars is the fact that this game is not worth buying it.  If this full game were free with ads I’d be happy but paying that money for a clicker that has an ending is not at all worth in my opinion.

It’s almost like the end of 2001...when they ran out of money for the movie. This game had a good start, an irrelevant and entertainment commentary, and seemingly a good intro to their method of play. Then it just ended abruptly with a bizarre retro video display that went on and on and on and on and then the game was over. I can’t remember the last time I deleted a game directly after finishing it, but this one is no longer on my iPad. It could have been so much better.

Kudos on the story line!  It felt like a cross between “Hitchhiker’s Guide to the Galaxy” and “2001: A Space Odyssey”

Congratulations on this clever game!

I was also very pleasantly surprised to find that your game did not have a single ad or micro transaction! 

I am so used to clickers games turning into a competition to see how many ads they can make me watch and constant pressure to open my wallet for micro transactions.

With those games, I don’t feel like the customer.  I feel like a dairy cow being milked.

You were able to write a game where the sole goal was to express your artistic vision and give your customers a great experience!

I don’t often write reviews, but my experience with your game was so refreshing that I felt compelled to do so in this case.
This game was amazing and I think an endless mode where u visit randomly generated planets would be amazing to kept the game going after the story ends

title.label: Cool game till it quit working

content.label: Well it was a fun game until it completely quit working.

I first found this clicker on kongregates website and thought it was great. First off it was a way better browser game than phone app. The app it’s self has really disappointed me. For $3 it’s really not worth it as game play is very quick I downloaded the game lastnight and have beat it twice within 24 hours. This to me is not worth $3 as it does not have that “play it again” attraction to it. I liked that it had an end eventually but like i said it was to short a game. Unless future updates are planned don’t waste your money on this. I’d highly suggest just playing the prototype online for free it may have a few less features but I feel it looks better and also you aren’t wasting money on very brief content.

I actually forgot I paid for this when I was about to review, but once I remembered I lowered my rating. Not worth the money. 

The style, humor, and fact it's a clicker with a goal are all nice things. That's good. 

But the clicker format was not very satisfying, actually kind of a nuisance. It certainly didn't revolutionize any of that. 

The story was fine. But the drawn out ending was not something I enjoyed or left with good feelings towards. I don't recommend this game unfortunately. I don't review often, but I had to share my dissatisfaction here.

title.label: Great but needs screen support for newer iPhones

content.label: Having moved from my Pixel 2XL to the iPhone XS, I needed to get this game again. It’s short but I’m happy to pay for it again. It keeps me entertained. The only downside to this game on iOS is the fact that it does not support the aspect ratio on the IPhone X, XS, XS Max, and XR screens. Instead the game scales down to fit the screen you have making everything a lot smaller than it actually is. Annoying but if you can deal with the aspect ratio being screwed up, then I highly recommend this game.
Watt Spender name should be changed to Joule Spender when activating Scientifically Accurate Mode.
Great Idle game but I I opened the game after an hour and lost all of my progress. I definitely didn’t hit the restart button. I have no clue what happened.
